pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:6.2: At that time a government official called Ārohanta had been given the full ordination as a monk
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:6.3: and his former wife as a nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:6.4: On one occasion that monk had his meal in the presence of that nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:6.5: Then, while he was eating, she attended on him with drinks and a fan, and she flirted with him.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:6.6: But the monk dismissed her, saying,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:6.9: “Before you did such and such to me, but now you’re not able to take even this much.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:6.10: And she dropped the water vessel upside down and struck him with the fan.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:7.1: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:7.2: “How can a nun strike a monk?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:8.1: ‘If, when a monk is eating, a nun attends on him with water or a fan, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:15.1: If he is fully ordained, and she perceives him as fully ordained, and she attends on him with drinks or with a fan, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:15.2: If he is fully ordained, but she is unsure if he is, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:15.3: If he is fully ordained, but she does not perceive him as fully ordained, and she attends on him with drinks or with a fan, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:16.1: If she attends on him from beyond arm’s reach, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:16.2: If she attends on him when he is eating non-staple food, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:16.3: If she attends on one who is not fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:16.4: If he is not fully ordained, but she perceives him as fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:16.5: If he is not fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:16.6: If he is not fully ordained, and she does not perceive him as fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
